author: Daniel Kruger
title: Dollar Rises With Short-Term Yield Surge
text:
The dollar rose, supported by rising short-term bond yields and an increase in government debt issuance.
The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the currency against a basket of 16 others, rose 0.1% to 83.96. The dollar was up 0.1% to $1.2291 a euro and declined 0.3% versus the yen to Â¥105.98. The dollar rose for the fourth consecutive week, and has gained 1.1% during that time.
